task.title: Creating a file system for backups

taskbody.prereq: To perform this procedure, you need a host with at least one unused primary partition, or a remote file server.

context.p: The master host requires local or remote storage space for backups of data. This procedure includes steps to create an XFS file system on a primary partition, if necessary, and steps to mount a file system for backups. For more information about primary partitions, refer to the .
context.note: If you are using a primary partition on a local device for backups, ensure that the primary partition for internal services data is not on the same device.

step.cmd: Log in to the target host .
Identify the target primary partition for the file system to create, if necessary.
step.info: Skip this step if you are using a remote file server.
step.stepresult: For more information about the output of the lsblk command, and about creating primary partitions, refer to the .

step.cmd: Create an XFS file system, if necessary.
step.info: Skip this step if you are using a remote file server.
step.stepxmp: Replace Partition with the path of the target primary partition: mkfs -t xfs Partition

step.cmd: Create an entry in the /etc/fstab file.

stepxmp.p: Replace File-System-Specification with one of the following values:

ul.li: the path of the primary partition used in the previous step

step.cmd: Create the mount point for backup data.
Mount the file system, and then verify it mounted correctly.
